TI: Relation-theoretic contraction principle
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Complete metric spaces; binary relations; contraction mappings
ID: PARTIALLY ORDERED SETS; ORDINARY DIFFERENTIAL-EQUATIONS; FIXED-POINT
AB: In this paper, we present yet another new and novel variant of classical Banach contraction principle on a complete metric space endowed with a binary relation which, under universal relation, reduces to Banach contraction principle. In process, we observe that various kinds of binary relations, such as partial order, preorder, transitive relation, tolerance, strict order, symmetric closure, etc., utilized by earlier authors in several well-known metrical fixed point theorems can be weakened to the extent of an arbitrary binary relation.
C1: [Alam, Aftab; Imdad, Mohammad] Aligarh Muslim Univ, Dept Math, Aligarh 202002, Uttar Pradesh, India
RP: Alam, A (reprint author), Aligarh Muslim Univ, Dept Math, Aligarh 202002, Uttar Pradesh, India.
FU: University Grant Commission, New Delhi, Government of India
FX: The authors are grateful to the anonymous referee for valuable suggestions and fruitful comments. The first author is thankful to University Grant Commission, New Delhi, Government of India for awarding BSR (Basic Scientific Research) Fellowship.

AU: Gibali, A; Reich, S; Zalas, R
AF: Gibali, Aviv; Reich, Simeon; Zalas, Rafal
TI: Iterative methods for solving variational inequalities in Euclidean space
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Almost cyclic control; common fixed point; intermittent control; iterative method; metric projection; nonexpansive operator; quasi-nonexpansive operator; subgradient projection; variational inequality
ID: FIXED-POINT SET; QUASI-NONEXPANSIVE MAPPINGS; CONVEX FEASIBILITY PROBLEMS; HILBERT-SPACES; PROJECTION METHOD; CONVERGENCE; OPERATORS; INTERSECTION
AB: In this paper, we investigate the convergence properties of an iterative method for solving variational inequalities in Euclidean space. We show that under certain assumptions the method can be applied to variational inequalities defined over the common fixed point set of a given infinite family of cutter operators. The main step of our method consists in the computation of the metric projection onto a certain superhalf- space, which is constructed using the input data defining the problem. Moreover, in the case where the common fixed point set is a finite intersection of the fixed point sets of cutters for which Opial's closedness principle holds, we show that the iterative method can be easily combined with either sequential, composition or convex combination type methods. We also discuss ways of applying our method to more general classes of operators such as quasi-nonexpansive and demi-contractive ones.
C1: [Gibali, Aviv] ORT Braude Coll, Dept Math, IL-21982 Karmiel, Israel; [Reich, Simeon; Zalas, Rafal] Technion Israel Inst Technol, Dept Math, IL-32000 Haifa, Israel

The third author was financially supported by the Polish National Science Centre within the framework of the Etiuda funding scheme under agreement No. DEC-2013/08/T/ST1/00177.

TI: Fixed points and Cauchy sequences in semimetric spaces
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Fixed points; Cauchy sequences; contraction mappings; metric spaces; semimetric spaces; generalized metric spaces; Caristi's theorem
AB: There have been numerous attempts recently to extend many of the metric standard fixed point theorems to a more general semimetric context. In many instances a weakened form of the triangle inequality is involved and the space is assumed to be complete. Thus Cauchy sequences play a central role. One of the standard tests to determine when a sequence is Cauchy in a metric space (X, d) is the summation criterion: If and , then {p (n) } is Cauchy. In this note we examine instances in which this criterion plays a critical role.
C1: [Kirk, W. A.] Univ Iowa, Dept Math, Iowa City, IA 52242 USA; [Shahzad, Naseer] King Abdulaziz Univ, Dept Math, Jeddah 21959, Saudi Arabia
RP: Kirk, WA (reprint author), Univ Iowa, Dept Math, Iowa City, IA 52242 USA.
FU: Deanship of Scientific Research (DSR), King Abdulaziz University, Jeddah; DSR
FX: This article was funded by the Deanship of Scientific Research (DSR), King Abdulaziz University, Jeddah. The authors acknowledge with thanks DSR for financial support. The authors are grateful to the reviewer for his useful comments.

TI: Generalized metric spaces: A survey
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Banach contraction principle; cone metric spaces; fixed point; generalized metric spaces; Menger spaces; b-metric spaces; G-metric spaces; modular metric spaces; partially ordered metric spaces
ID: PARTIALLY ORDERED SETS; POINT; CONTRACTION; MAPPINGS; THEOREMS
AB: Banach's contraction mapping principle is remarkable in its simplicity, yet it is perhaps the most widely applied fixed point theorem in all of analysis with special applications to the theory of differential and integral equations. Because the underlined space of this theorem is a metric space, the theory that developed following its publication is known as the metric fixed point theory. Over the last one hundred years, many people have tried to generalize the definition of a metric space. In this paper, we survey the most popular generalizations and we discuss the recent uptick in some generalizations and their impact in metric fixed point theory.
C1: [Khamsi, M. A.] Univ Texas El Paso, Dept Math Sci, El Paso, TX 79968 USA; [Khamsi, M. A.] King Fahd Univ Petr & Minerals, Dept Math & Stat, Dhahran 31261, Saudi Arabia
RP: Khamsi, MA (reprint author), Univ Texas El Paso, Dept Math Sci, El Paso, TX 79968 USA.
FU: King Abdulaziz City for Science and Technology (KACST), Riyadh, Saudi Arabia [ARP-32-34]
FX: The author acknowledges gratefully the support of King Abdulaziz City for Science and Technology (KACST), Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, for supporting Research Project ARP-32-34.

TI: A variational inequality in complete CAT(0) spaces
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Hadamard space; fixed point; variational inequality; nonexpansive mapping; Delta-convergence; strong convergence
AB: In this paper, first, existence of solutions for a variational inequality associated with a nonexpansive mapping in Hadamard spaces is studied. Then, the inexact proximal point algorithm for approximation of a solution of the variational inequality, which is also a fixed point of the nonexpansive mapping, is proposed. We prove the -convergence of the generated sequence by the algorithm as well as the strong convergence of a Halpern-type regularization one to a fixed point of the nonexpansive mapping. Our motivation is to give a step toward investigation of variational inequalities in CAT(0) spaces.
C1: [Khatibzadeh, Hadi; Ranjbar, Sajad] Univ Zanjan, Dept Math, Zanjan, Iran
RP: Khatibzadeh, H (reprint author), Univ Zanjan, Dept Math, POB 45195-313, Zanjan, Iran.

AU: Bahyrycz, A; Brzdek, J; Jablonska, E; Olko, J
AF: Bahyrycz, Anna; Brzdek, Janusz; Jablonska, Eliza; Olko, Jolanta
TI: On functions that are approximate fixed points almost everywhere and Ulam's type stability
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Ulam's type stability; fixed point almost everywhere; approximate fixed point; nonlinear operator
AB: In this paper, we investigate functions that are approximate fixed points of some (possibly nonlinear) operators almost everywhere, with respect to some ideals of sets. We prove that (under suitable assumptions) there exist fixed points of the operators that are "near" those functions. The results are applied to obtain some general stability results of Ulam's type almost everywhere; in particular, for the polynomial functional equation.
C1: [Bahyrycz, Anna; Brzdek, Janusz] Pedag Univ, Dept Math, PL-30084 Krakow, Poland; [Jablonska, Eliza] Rzeszow Univ Technol, Dept Math, PL-35959 Rzeszow, Poland; [Olko, Jolanta] AGH Univ Sci & Technol, Fac Appl Math, PL-30059 Krakow, Poland

TI: On Caristi-type mappings without lower semicontinuity assumptions
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Fixed point; directed set; net; orbit; influential function; w-distance; w(rw)-distance; rough quasi-distance; Caristi-type mapping; MT-function (R-function); Banach contraction principle; Caristi's fixed point theorem
ID: EKELANDS VARIATIONAL PRINCIPLE; FIXED-POINT THEOREMS; COMPLETE METRIC-SPACES; GENERALIZED DISTANCE; EXISTENCE; MAPS
AB: In this paper, we establish some new fixed point theorems for generalized distances and Caristi-type mappings without assuming that the dominated functions possess lower semicontinuity property. As applications of these results, we obtain some new fixed point theorems which generalize and improve the famous Banach contraction principle.

TI: Symmetric equilibria for the N-vortex problem
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Fluid dynamics; Kirchhoff-Routh path function; variational methods
ID: BOUNDED PLANAR DOMAINS; SINH-POISSON; EQUATIONS; EXISTENCE
AB: This paper is concerned with the study of existence and properties of symmetric stationary solutions for the dynamics of N point vortices in an ideal fluid constrained to a dihedrally symmetric two-dimensional domain , which is governed by a Hamiltonian system Gamma(i)dxi/dt = partial derivative H Omega/partial derivative yi (z(1), ... , z(N)), Gamma(i)dyi/dt = partial derivative H Omega/partial derivative xi (z(1), ... , z(N)), where z(i) = (x(i), y(i)), i = 1, ... , N, and where H-Omega(z) := (N)Sigma(j=1) Gamma(2)(j)h(z(j)) + (N)Sigma(i,j=1, i not equal j) Gamma(i)Gamma(j)G(z(i),z(j)) is the so-called Kirchhoff-Routh path function under some conditions on the vorticities Gamma(i).
C1: Univ Giessen, Math Inst, D-35392 Giessen, Germany
RP: Kuhl, C (reprint author), Univ Giessen, Math Inst, Arndtstr 2, D-35392 Giessen, Germany.

TI: Best proximity point results for MK-proximal contractions on ordered sets
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Best proximity point; partially ordered set; metric space; MK-proximal contraction; fixed point
AB: We discuss the existence and uniqueness of solutions to the minimization problem min(x is an element of A) d(x, Tx), where A, B are nonempty subsets of a partially ordered set X endowed with a metric d, and T : A -> B is a non-self-mapping satisfying a proximal contraction of Meir-Keeler type (MK-proximal contraction). An iterative algorithm is also provided to approximate the optimal solution. As particular cases of our obtained results, various fixed point theorems on a metric space endowed with a partial order are deduced.

RP: Jleli, M (reprint author), King Saud Univ, Dept Math, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

AU: Takahashi, W; Wong, NC; Yao, JC
AF: Takahashi, Wataru; Wong, Ngai-Ching; Yao, Jen-Chih
TI: Attractive points and Halpern-type strong convergence theorems in Hilbert spaces
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Attractive point; fixed point; generalized hybrid mapping; Halpern-type iteration; nonexpansive mapping
ID: GENERALIZED HYBRID MAPPINGS; NONEXPANSIVE-MAPPINGS; FIXED-POINTS; NONLINEAR MAPPINGS; BANACH-SPACES; APPROXIMATION; WEAK
AB: In this paper, using the concept of attractive points of a nonlinear mapping, we obtain a strong convergence theorem of Halpern's type [Bull. Amer. Math. Soc. 73 (1967), 957-961] for a wide class of nonlinear mappings which contains nonexpansive mappings, nonspreading mappings and hybrid mappings in a Hilbert space. Using this result, we obtain well-known and new strong convergence theorems of Halpern's type in a Hilbert space. In particular, we solve a problem posed by Kurokawa and Takahashi [Nonlinear Anal. 73 (2010), 1562-1568].

AU: Cibulka, R; Fabian, M; Ioffe, AD
AF: Cibulka, Radek; Fabian, Marian; Ioffe, Alexander D.
TI: On primal regularity estimates for single-valued mappings
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Metric regularity; linear openness; tangential approximation; contingent tangent cone; strict prederivative; measure of noncompactness; Clarke's inverse function theorem; cofinal family; renorming; non-smooth analysis
ID: METRIC REGULARITY; THEOREM; SET; MULTIFUNCTIONS; CALCULUS; OPENNESS; MAPS
AB: Based on a primal regularity criterion we provide lower bounds for the regularity modulus of a nonlinear single-valued mapping F from a Banach space X into another Banach space Y . We focus on the case when F is defined on a proper (closed convex) subset of X only rather than on the whole of X. Three possible ways of approximating F around the reference point are considered. First, we use a tangential approximation by set-valued mappings associated with the Bouligand's tangent cone to the graph of F. Then we move on to approximations by positively homogeneous set-valued mappings whose graphs contain the graph of F, for example, by the strict prederivative. Finally, we use an approximation by bunches of continuous linear operators. In the first two cases finding approximating objects is relatively easy while in the third case the approximating object is very convenient to work with. On examples, we illustrate that these approaches are different and neither of them implies the other, unless the spaces in question are finite dimensional.
C1: [Cibulka, Radek] Univ W Bohemia, Fac Sci Appl, NTIS, Dept Math, Plzen 30614, Czech Republic; [Fabian, Marian] Acad Sci Czech Republic, Math Inst, CR-11567 Prague, Czech Republic; [Ioffe, Alexander D.] Technion Israel Inst Technol, Dept Math, IL-32000 Haifa, Israel
RP: Cibulka, R (reprint author), Univ W Bohemia, Fac Sci Appl, NTIS, Dept Math, Univ 22, Plzen 30614, Czech Republic.

TI: On approximate ternary m-derivations and sigma-homomorphisms
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Ternary algebras; stability; approximation; derivations; homomorphisms
AB: In this paper, we introduce ternary modules over ternary algebras and, using fixed point methods, we prove the stability and superstability of ternary additive, quadratic, cubic and quartic derivations and sigma-homomorphisms in such structures for the functional equation f(ax + y) + f(ax - y) = a m(-2) [f(x + y) + f(x - y)] + 2 (a(2) - 1)[a(m-2) f(x) + (m - 2)(1 - ( m - 2)(2))/6 f(y)] for each m = 1, 2, 3, 4.
C1: [Ghazanfari, A. G.; Alizadeh, Z.] Lorestan Univ, Dept Math, Khorramabad, Iran
RP: Ghazanfari, AG (reprint author), Lorestan Univ, Dept Math, POB 465, Khorramabad, Iran.

TI: Multidomination of metric spaces in the context of multimorphisms
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Multidomination; absolute multiretract; absolute neighborhood multiretract; multifunction; multicontractible; path connected; locally path connected; Vietoris map
AB: The application of the theory of multimorphisms leads to the presentation of a new definition of a multidomination of metric spaces. With the help of this definition we obtain the new properties of multidomination in regard to multicontractibility, path connectedness and locally path connectedness.
C1: Koszalin Univ Technol, PL-75453 Koszalin, Poland
RP: Slosarski, M (reprint author), Koszalin Univ Technol, Sniadeckich 2, PL-75453 Koszalin, Poland.

TI: Generalized F-iterated function systems on product of metric spaces
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: F-contraction; generalized F-contraction; generalized iterated function system; attractor; Hausdorff-Pompeiu metric; fixed point
AB: In this paper, we start from an F-contraction defined on a metric space X into itself, introduced by Wardowski [Fixed Point Theory Appl. 2012 (2012), doi:10.1186/1687-1812-2012-94], and extend it to the case of mappings defined on the space X (I) into X endowed with the supremum metric, where I is a set of positive integers. Next, we consider the generalized iterated function systems composed of F-contractions on X (I) improving some fixed point results from the classical Hutchinson-Barnsley theory of iterated function systems. Some illustrative examples are given.
C1: Lucian Blaga Univ Sibiu, Dept Math & Informat, Fac Sci, Sibiu, Romania
RP: Secelean, NA (reprint author), Lucian Blaga Univ Sibiu, Dept Math & Informat, Fac Sci, Sibiu, Romania.

TI: Nielsen zeta functions for maps on infra-nilmanifolds are rational
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Nielsen number; Lefschetz number; infra-nilmanifold; zeta function
AB: In this paper, we show that the Nielsen number N(f) of any map f on an infra-nilmanifold is either equal to vertical bar L(f)vertical bar, where L(f) is the Lefschetz number of that map, or equal to vertical bar L(f)-L(f(+))vertical bar, where f(+) is a lift of f to a 2-fold covering of that infra-nilmanifold. By exploiting the exact nature of this relationship for all powers of f, we prove that the Nielsen dynamical zeta function for a map on an infra-nilmanifold is always a rational function.
C1: [Dekimpe, Karel; Dugardein, Gert-Jan] KU Leuven Kulak, B-8500 Kortrijk, Belgium

TI: Lefschetz indices for n-valued maps
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Lefschetz index; Nielsen-Reidemeister trace; finite covering space; multivalued map; fixed-point transfer
ID: FIBER-PRESERVING MAPS; FIXED-POINT INDEXES; NIELSEN COINCIDENCE; NUMBERS
AB: We give a systematic exposition of the construction and properties of Lefschetz fixed-point indices for the n-valued maps studied by Schirmer, Brown and others, using techniques introduced by Dold. In particular, we discuss Dold's fixed-point transfer [Math. Z. 148 (1976), 215-244] and a homotopy version of that transfer constructed by Ponto and Shulman [Algebr. Geom. Topol. 14 (2014), 1275-1306].

TI: A hybrid nonlinear alternative theorem and some hybrid fixed point theorems for multimaps
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS

ID: SELECTION THEOREM; 2 OPERATORS; MAPPINGS; EQUATIONS; SUM
AB: We present a Krasnosel'skii-Schaefer-type nonlinear alternative theorem and some fixed point theorems of Krasnosel'skii-Sadowskii (or Daher) type for multimaps. Our results improve or extend in a broad sense recent ones obtained in literature.

SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS

AB: In this paper, we establish the existence of solutions to firstorder differential equations with nonlinear differential operators satisfying the periodic boundary value or the initial value conditions. Notions of upper and lower solutions are introduced. Multiplicity results are also presented.

AU: Gordji, ME; Khodaei, H; Rassias, TM
AF: Gordji, M. E.; Khodaei, H.; Rassias, Th. M.
TI: Fixed points and generalized stability for quadratic and quartic mappings in C*-algebras
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: beta-Banach space; C*-algebra; fixed point; homogeneous map; stability
AB: We consider the following quadratic and quartic functional equations: f (root xx* + yy*) = f(x) + f(y), f (root xx* + yy*) + f(root vertical bar xx* - yy*vertical bar) = 2f(x) + 2f(y) in C*-algebras. We also prove the stability of these functional equations in beta-normed spaces by using the Banach fixed point theorem and a direct method.

TI: Common fixed point property through analysis of retractions
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Retraction; nonexpansive mapping; weak* fixed point property; commutative semigroup
AB: In this paper, we study the problem of the existence of common fixed points for a commuting family of nonexpansive mappings. One of our objectives is to provide a simple proof to a more general version of a well-known result due to Bruck which states that if a Banach space has the weak fixed point property, then it has the weak fixed point property for commuting semigroups. As a consequence, we obtain that if a dual Banach space E with a separable predual has the weak* fixed point property and the fixed point property for spheres, then E has the weak* fixed point property for commuting semigroups. This is done through analysis of existence of the so-called retractions.
C1: Univ Kurdistan, Dept Math, Kurdistan, Iran
RP: Saeidi, S (reprint author), Univ Kurdistan, Dept Math, Sanandaj 416, Kurdistan, Iran.

AB: The purpose of this paper is to generalize well-known results of Wall [Ann. of Math. (2) 72 (1960), 429-444] and Arnon [J. Pure Appl. Algebra 96 (1994), 215-223] on monomial bases for the mod 2 Steenrod algebra to the mod p Steenrod algebra, p > 2. We also establish certain interesting property of our bases, which presumably has no analogue for p = 2.

TI: New constructions of symplectically fat fiber bundles
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS

AB: This work is devoted to new constructions of symplectically fat fiber bundles. The latter are constructed in two ways: using the Kirwan map and expressing the fatness condition in terms of the isotropy representation related to the G-structure over some homogeneous spaces.

TI: Fixed point indices of central configurations
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Central configurations; relative equilibria; n-body problem
ID: CLASSIFYING RELATIVE EQUILIBRIA; N-BODY PROBLEM; BODIES; FINITENESS; MECHANICS; TOPOLOGY
AB: Central configurations of n point particles in with respect to a potential function U are shown to be the same as the fixed points of the normalized gradient map , which is an SO(d)-equivariant self-map defined on the inertia ellipsoid. We show that the SO(d)-orbits of fixed points of F are all fixed points of the map induced on the quotient by SO(d), and we give a formula relating their indices (as fixed points) with their Morse indices (as critical points). At the end, we give an example of a nonplanar relative equilibrium which is not a central configuration.
C1: Univ Milano Bicocca, Dept Math & Applicat, I-20125 Milan, Italy
RP: Ferrario, DL (reprint author), Univ Milano Bicocca, Dept Math & Applicat, Via R Cozzi 55, I-20125 Milan, Italy.

TI: Convex KKM maps, monotone operators and Minty variational inequalities
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: KKM principle; finite intersection property; monotone operator; convex set; Minty variational inequality
AB: It is known that for convex sets, the Knaster-Kuratowski-Mazurkiewicz (KKM) condition is equivalent to the finite intersection property. We use this equivalence to obtain a characterization of monotone operators in terms of convex KKM maps and in terms of the existence of solutions to Minty variational inequalities. The latter result provides a converse to the seminal theorem of Minty.
C1: Univ Antilles, F-97159 Pointe a Pitre, Guadeloupe, Guadeloupe
RP: Lassonde, M (reprint author), Univ Antilles, F-97159 Pointe a Pitre, Guadeloupe, Guadeloupe.

TI: The index bundle and bifurcation from infinity of solutions of nonlinear elliptic boundary value problems
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Bifurcation from infinity; nonlinear elliptic boundary value problems; Fredholm maps; index bundle; J-homomorphism; family index theorem
AB: We present three criteria for bifurcation from infinity of solutions of general boundary value problems for nonlinear elliptic systems of partial differential equations. Our sufficient conditions for bifurcation are computable, via the Atiyah-Singer family index theorem, from the coefficients of derivatives of leading order of the linearized differential operators and do not involve the analysis of the asymptotic derivative at infinity.

TI: 70 Years of asymptotic fixed point theory
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Asymptotic fixed point theorems; ejective fixed points; generalized Lefschetz number; (mod p)-theorem; delay differential equations; periodic solutions
ID: NON-COMPACT SPACES; LEFSCHETZ THEOREM; INDEX; PRINCIPLES; ATTRACTORS; CONES
AB: In this expository article we aim to illustrate asymptotic fixed point theory from the viewpoints of its history, the main motivation from applications, the two basic techniques for proofs and a survey on the major results. The bibliography should cover most aspects but is, for sure, not complete. We confine ourselves to results from topological fixed point theory, i.e., metric fixed point theory is not at all touched.
C1: Univ Munich, Math Inst, D-80333 Munich, Germany
RP: Steinlein, H (reprint author), Univ Munich, Math Inst, Theresienstr 39, D-80333 Munich, Germany.

TI: Gromov compactness for holomorphic discs with totally real boundary conditions
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Totally real boundary; stable maps; holomorphic discs; Gromov convergence
ID: WEINSTEIN CONJECTURE; HIGHER DIMENSIONS; CURVES; IMMERSIONS; MANIFOLDS; HOMOLOGY; THEOREM; DISKS
AB: We prove that a sequence of holomorphic discs with totally real boundary conditions has a subsequence that Gromov converges to a stable holomorphic map of genus zero with connected boundary provided that the sequence is bounded and has bounded energy.

TI: On local fixed or periodic point properties
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Local fixed point property; local periodic point property; locally connected continuum
AB: A space X has the local fixed point property LFPP (resp., local periodic point property LPPP) if it has an open basis such that, for each , the closure has the fixed (resp., periodic) point property. Weaker versions wLFPP, wLPPP are also considered and examples of metric continua that distinguish all these properties are constructed. We show that for planar or one-dimensional locally connected metric continua the properties are equivalent.
C1: [Illanes, Alejandro] Univ Nacl Autonoma Mexico, Inst Matemat, Mexico City 04510, DF, Mexico; [Krupski, Pawe] Univ Wroclaw, Inst Math, PL-50384 Wroclaw, Poland

The authors wish to thank the participants for useful discussions, particularly, Rocio Leonel, Jorge M. Martinez, Norberto Ordonez and Jose A. Rodriguez. This paper was partially supported by the projects "Hiperespacios topologicos (0128584)" of Consejo Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnologia (CONACYT), 2009 and "Teoria de Continuos, Hiperespacios y Sistemas Dinamicos" (IN104613) of PAPIIT, DGAPA, UNAM.

TI: Inhomogeneous poly-scale refinement type equations and Markov operators with perturbations
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Inhomogeneous poly-scale refinement type equations; Markov operators with perturbations; fixed points; L-p-solutions; continuous and bounded solutions; compactly supported solutions
AB: Given measure spaces (Omega(1), A(1), mu(1)), ... , (Omega(N), A(N), mu(N)), functions phi(1) : R-m x Omega(1) -> R-m, ... , phi(N) : R-m x Omega(N) -> R-m and g : R-m -> R, we present results on the existence of solutions f : R-m -> R of the inhomogeneous poly-scale refinement type equation of the form f(x) = (N)Sigma(n=1)integral(Omega n) vertical bar det(phi(n))(x)'(x,omega(n))vertical bar f(phi(n))(x)'(x,omega(n))) d mu(n)(omega(n)) + g(x) in some special classes of functions. The results are obtained by Banach fixed point theorem applied to a perturbed Markov operator connected with the considered inhomogeneous poly-scale refinement type equation.
C1: [Kapica, Rafal; Morawiec, Janusz] Silesian Univ, Inst Math, PL-40007 Katowice, Poland

AF: Avery, Richard; Henderson, Johnny; Liu, Xueyan
TI: Omitted ray fixed point theorem
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Fixed point theorems; omitted ray; compression; expansion; Altman; Leggett-Williams
AB: This paper presents a functional version of Altman's condition as an alternative to the standard inward-outward techniques used in the Krasnoselskii and Leggett-Williams type fixed point theorems. Leggett-Williams type arguments are utilized to minimize the conditions on the boundaries of the functional wedges.

SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Fixed point; condensing map; Lefschetz number
AB: On a subset of Banach space which is a locally finite union of closed, convex sets, we extend the Lefschetz fixed point theorem for set-valued mappings. As an application of this result we give a partial answer to Nussbaum's conjecture for set-valued mappings.

TI: Morse cohomology in a Hilbert space via the Conley index
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Morse homology; Morse-Witten-Floer complex; Conley index; Seiberg-Witten-Floer homology
AB: The main theorem of this paper states that Morse cohomology groups in a Hilbert space are isomorphic to the cohomological Conley index. It is also shown that calculating the cohomological Conley index does not require finite-dimensional approximations of the vector field. Further directions are discussed.
C1: [Starostka, Maciej] Polish Acad Sci, Inst Math, PL-00956 Warsaw, Poland; [Starostka, Maciej] Gdansk Univ Technol, Fac Tech Phys & Appl Math, PL-80952 Gdansk, Poland

TI: Holomorphic jets in symplectic manifolds
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Holomorphic curves; Gromov-Witten invariants; transversality; higher-order jet constraints; Fredholm theory; local behaviour of holomorphic discs
AB: We define pointwise partial differential relations for holomorphic discs. Given a relative homotopy class, a relation, and a generic almost complex structure, we provide the moduli space of discs that have an injective point with the structure of a smooth manifold. Applications to the local behaviour are given and an inequality for the number of singularities is derived. Moreover, we show that for a coordinate class of a monotone Lagrangian split torus generically the number of nonimmersed holomorphic discs is even.
C1: Univ Munster, Inst Math, D-48149 Munster, Germany
RP: Zehmisch, K (reprint author), Univ Munster, Inst Math, Einsteinstr 62, D-48149 Munster, Germany.

AU: Avery, RI; Graef, JR; Liu, XY
AF: Avery, Richard I.; Graef, John R.; Liu, Xueyan
TI: Compression fixed point theorems of operator type
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Fixed point theorems; operator; Leggett-Williams fixed point theorems; boundary value problems
AB: This paper is concerned with new fixed point theorems of operator type that are proved by fixed point index theory and are generalizations of the Leggett-Williams fixed point theorems. With additional structures on the inward and outward boundaries of a conical region, the theorems can be used to prove the existence of solutions of boundary value problems for nonlinear differential equations with dependence on higher-order derivatives, and they can provide nonlocal upper and lower bounds on the solutions. An application is given to demonstrate these advantages.
C1: [Avery, Richard I.] Dakota State Univ, Coll Arts & Sci, Madison, SD 57042 USA; [Graef, John R.; Liu, Xueyan] Univ Tennessee, Dept Math, Chattanooga, TN 37403 USA
RP: Avery, RI (reprint author), Dakota State Univ, Coll Arts & Sci, Madison, SD 57042 USA.

TI: Second-order set-valued differential equations with boundary conditions
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Boundary conditions; Green's function; Hukuhara derivatives
ID: HUKUHARA DIFFERENTIABILITY; BANACH-SPACES; INCLUSIONS; CONVEXITY; SYSTEMS
AB: In this paper, we prove the existence and uniqueness of a solution for a second-order set-valued differential equation with three-point boundary conditions, where the perturbation is measurable with respect to the time variable and Lipschitzian with respect to the second and third variables.

AU: Crabb, MC; Mishchenko, AS; Melendez, QM; Popelensky, TY
AF: Crabb, M. C.; Mishchenko, A. S.; Morales Melendez, Q.; Popelensky, Th. Yu.
TI: The Conner-Floyd bordism exact sequence-a new perspective
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Conner-Floyd exact sequence; classifying space; proper action of a countable discrete group
AB: Recent work of Mishchenko and Morales Melendez [math.AT], 2011) has shed new light on the classical exact sequence of Conner and Floyd in G-equivariant bordism for a finite group G. This paper is primarily an exposition of the results obtained there as specialized to finite groups. For a countable discrete group G, there is a brief discussion of the generalization to the bordism theory of proper, cocompact G-manifolds.

TI: A multiplicity result for double singularly perturbed elliptic systems
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Schrodinger-Maxwell systems; Schrodinger-Poisson-Slater equation; Riemannian manifold; singular perturbation
AB: We show that the number of low-energy solutions of a double singularly perturbed Schrodinger-Maxwell-type system on a smooth three-dimensional manifold (M, g) depends on the topological properties of the manifold. The result is obtained via the Lusternik-Schnirelmann category theory.

AU: Liou, JM; Schwarz, A; Xu, RJ
AF: Liou, Jia-Ming (Frank); Schwarz, Albert; Xu, Renjun
TI: Weierstrass cycles and tautological rings in various moduli spaces of algebraic curves
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Weierstrass cycle; Weierstrass semigroup; Weierstrass gap sequence; tautological ring; factorial Schur function
AB: We analyze Weierstrass cycles and tautological rings in moduli spaces of smooth algebraic curves and in moduli spaces of integral algebraic curves with embedded disks with special attention to moduli spaces of curves having genus less than or equal to 6. In particular, we show that our general formula gives a good estimate for the dimension of Weierstrass cycles for low genera.
C1: [Liou, Jia-Ming (Frank)] Natl Cheng Kung Univ, Dept Math, Tainan 701, Taiwan; [Liou, Jia-Ming (Frank)] Natl Cheng Kung Univ, Res Ctr Theoret Sci, Tainan 701, Taiwan; [Schwarz, Albert] Univ Calif Davis, Dept Math, Davis, CA 95616 USA; [Xu, Renjun] Univ Calif Davis, Dept Phys, Davis, CA 95616 USA

TI: Sufficient conditions for the existence of solutions for a thermoelectrochemical problem
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Thermoelectrochemical problem; smallness conditions
AB: A mathematical model is introduced for thermoelectrochemical phenomena in an electrolysis cell, and its qualitative analysis is focused on existence of solutions. The model consists of a system of nonlinear parabolic PDEs in conservation form expressing conservation of energy, mass and charge. On the other hand, an integral form of Newton's law is used to describe heat exchange at the electrolyte/electrode interface, a nonlinear radiation condition is enforced on the heat flux at the wall and a nonlinear boundary condition is considered for the electrochemical flux in order to account for Butler-Volmer kinetics. The main objective is the nonconstant character of each parameter, that is, the coefficients are assumed to be dependent on the spatial variable and the temperature. Making recourse of known estimates of solutions for some auxiliary elliptic and parabolic problems, which are explicitly determined by the Gehring-Giaquinta-Modica theory, we find sufficient smallness conditions on the data to guarantee the existence of the original solutions via the Schauder fixed point argument. These conditions may provide useful information for numerical as well as real applications. We conclude with an example of application, namely the electrolysis of molten sodium chloride.

TI: Nonlinear ergodic theorems for amenable semigroups of nonexpansive mappings in Hadamard spaces
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Nonpositive curvature; Hadamard space; nonexpansive semigroup; fixed point; Delta-convergence; nonlinear ergodic theorem; invariant mean
AB: We generalize some theorems for continuous representation of an amenable semitopological semigroup S as nonexpansive maps on Hilbert spaces to complete CAT(0) spaces, i.e., Hadamard spaces. For proper Hadamard space, we prove the convergence of asymptotically invariant means of the bounded trajectories. In the nonproper case, adding a suitable condition on the means and assuming S is a locally compact Hausdorff semigroup, we prove -convergence of asymptotically invariant means of the bounded trajectories.
C1: Shahid Beheshti Univ, GC, Dept Math, Tehran, Iran
RP: Kakavandi, BA (reprint author), Shahid Beheshti Univ, GC, Dept Math, Tehran, Iran.

TI: On the stable Conley index in Hilbert spaces
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Conley index in Hilbert spaces; Conley index; finite-dimensional approximation
AB: In this paper, we study Conley theory of flows on a Hilbert space. Our approach is to apply finite-dimensional approximation which is a slight refinement of the construction developed by GA (TM) ba, Izydorek, and Pruszko (1999). For instance, we include subspaces other than invariant subspaces in the construction. As a main result, we define a stable Conley index as an object in the stable homotopy category and show that it does not depend on choices in the construction.

AB: In this paper, we introduce a new characterisation of closed symplectically aspherical manifolds which can be understood as the symplectic analogue of the Shafarevich conjecture.

TI: Dynamics of functions arising from Pisot and Salem polynomials
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Complex dynamics; polynomials; Salem numbers
AB: Let Q(z) = z(n) P(z) - z(deg P) P(z(-1)), where P is the minimal polynomial of a Pisot number. Boyd [Duke Math. J. 44 (1977), 315-328] showed that, for n > deg P - 2 P'(1)/P(1), Q is the product of cyclotomic polynomials and the minimal polynomial of a Salem number, say alpha. In this paper, we study the dynamics of the Newton map N = z - Q/Q' induced by Q in the immediate basin U-alpha of alpha. We establish that N is a 2-fold covering map of U-alpha onto itself. Furthermore, there exists a conformal mapping phi of U-alpha onto the open unit disk D such that (phi circle N circle phi(-1))(z) = z(2) for all z is an element of D.

TI: Coincidences and secondary Nielsen numbers
SO: JOURNAL OF FIXED POINT THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
DE: Coincidence; Nielsen number; minimum number; Wecken theorem; Kervaire invariant
AB: Let be maps between smooth connected manifolds of dimensions m and n. Can f (1), f (2) be deformed by homotopies until they are coincidence free (i.e., for all ? The main tool for addressing such a problem is traditionally the (primary) Nielsen number N(f (1), f (2)). For example, when m < 2n - 2, the question above has a positive answer precisely if N(f (1), f (2)) = 0. However, when m = 2n - 2, this can be dramatically wrong, e.g. in the fixed point case when m = n = 2. Also, in a very specific setting the Kervaire invariant appears as a (full) additional obstruction. In this paper we start exploring a fairly general new approach. This leads to secondary Nielsen numbers SecN(f (1), f (2)) which allow us to answer our question, e.g., when , is even and Y is simply connected.
